Title: Make someone happy
Decscription: A new study shows that doing kind things for others is an important path to happiness.
Example: Give a sincere compliment -  Smile - Help them carry their stuff - Pay the toll fare for the car behind you - Give presents - Thank them for a job well done - Bake cookies.

Title: Plan something special with your love ones
Decscription: Surprises can bring joy and excitement. Plan a fun outing with your loved ones to create happy memories.
Example: A Surprise Meal - Going to a theme park - Having a picnic in the park- Visiting a museum or art gallery - going to a concert or live performance, having a movie night at home with popcorn and snacks

Title: Try to eat healthier for one week.
Decscription: Eating healthy has lots of advantages. It helps make your bones strong, keeps your heart healthy, prevents illnesses, and improves your mood.
Example: Try to avoid fried foods and fast food - Avoid heavy gravies, salad dressings, or sauces and use whole-grain bread, low fat milk and yogurt - Eat plenty of fruits and vegetables - Choose foods that are low in added sugars, saturated fats, and salt

Title: Pick one of your unhealthy habits and make the decision to stop doing it.
Decscription: It usually takes around 30 to 60 days to break a habit. When you examine your lifestyle, you realize how easy it is to develop a list of unhealthy habits. However, those who are aware of their bad habits and can break them are the ones who succeed in real life.
Example: Stop sitting around waiting for the perfect moment to begin something - Stop refusing to Learn Anything New - Stop watching too much TV- Quit nail biting - Quit smoking - Stop focusing on the Negatives - Stop being late all the time - Quit using drugs

Title: Invite your friend/friends over
Decscription: Having good friends is important for your health. Research shows that older adults who have strong relationships and support from others tend to live longer compared to those who have fewer connections.

Title: Buy a flower for yourself or your loved one
Decscription: Getting flowers not only feels nice, but they also make people genuinely smile and can have a long-lasting positive impact on someone's mood.

Title: Start reading a book or listen to an audiobook
Decscription: Reading is a great way to acquire knowledge and can enhance your memory and concentration. It strengthens your brain, exposes you to new ideas, encourages problem-solving, improves communication skills, and helps reduce stress.
Example: To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee - 1984 by George Orwel- Pride and Prejudice by Jane Austen - The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgeral - The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger - The Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling- The Lord of the Rings trilogy by J.R.R. Tolkien - The Chronicles of Narnia series by C.S. Lewis - The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho - To Kill a Kingdom by Alexandra Christo

Title: Donate to charity or help those in poverty
Decscription: The act of helping others, donating to charity, or volunteering your time, will give you an improved sense of wellbeing
Example: Give money to reputable charities - Donate food, clothes, toys, old furniture, and books to the nearest charitable organisation - Provide clean water and meal kits to the homeless community in your local area - Provide employment opportunities for needy people

Title: Set a short goal for yourself
Decscription: Short-term goals are targets that you set for yourself to achieve in a relatively short period of time, often ranging from a few days to a few months. Setting short-term goals that are regularly attainable, can help you to stay motivated.
Example: Reading two books in a month - Spending less time on social media - Exercising 30 minutes every day - Finishing an online course - learning 50 new vocabulary of new language in one month -Taking up a new hobby - Drinking 8 glass of water every day - Losing 2kg weight in one month

Title: Smile more often
Decscription: Whether your smile is genuine or not, it can act on your body and mind in a variety of positive ways. Smiling helps people relax, Elevates Mood, Boosts the Immune System, Lower Blood Pressure, Helps You Stay Positive and indicates confidence.

Title: Write Morning Pages
Decscription: The idea is to wake up, find a comfortable place without distractions, open your morning journal, and write three pages by hand of any thoughts that come to your mind. Julia Cameron, the author of The Artist's Way, came up with this method of journaling to help people unleash their creativity. Morning pages help you clear your mind and write down all your noisy thoughts on paper, which makes space for more important thoughts. It can also reduce your stress and anxiety. Many worries come from things we can't change, but when you write them down, it takes away their power. Writing morning pages allows you to process your emotions, unleash your creativity, and quiet your inner critic.

Title: Cook a new dish
Decscription: Cooking has the ability to give you the power to make tasty and nutritious meals for yourself and your family. It can help you save money and also provide some enjoyment in the process. Additionally, it can give you a sense of independence.
Example: You can try some simple dishes from around the world: Kabab Tabei, Persian Food - Borani Banjan, Afghan Eggplant Dish - Tandoori Chicken, Indian Dish - Kibbeh, Lebanese Dishes - Burritos, Mexican dish - Stuffed Potatoes, French dish - Crunchy garlic chicken - Vegetarian fried rice - Stuffed mushroom - Borek - Pastry dish from Turkey - Mac and cheese - Dal Soup - Rice kofta, Egyptian Dish - Ratatouille - Tuna melt - Moussaka - Greek Eggplant dish

Title: If you don't exercise much, try to start exercising for at least 15 minutes every day for two weeks. If you already exercise, add an extra 10 minutes to your routine.
Decscription: Fifteen minutes may not seem like a long time, but according to the American College of Sports Medicine, it's a good starting point for fitness. Whether it's walking or doing something more intense, these short workouts can still be very helpful for your body. They can improve circulation, enhance your mood, and increase your metabolism.
Example: Walking - Stretches - Squat - Bridge - Push up - Bicycle Crunch - Plank

Title: Watch sunset
Decscription: Watching the sunset can help you relax and appreciate the beauty of nature, which can reduce your stress.

Title: Watch sunrise
Decscription: The sun is such a magnificent energy. Look up and witness the beauty. Research has shown that. Watching the sunrise can boost your mood, reduce inflammation and depression, and improve your sleep at night.

Title: Donate clothes that you haven't used for two years or more
Decscription: By donating clothes that you haven't used for a long time, you are not only reducing consumerism and waste but also providing assistance to people in need.

Title: Clean out and organise one of your drawers
Decscription: Create a routine that helps you tackle messy drawers, cluttered surfaces, and crowded closets to reduce feelings of anxiety. Cleaning out and organizing drawers can improve our productivity and efficiency. It can also help us identify items that we no longer need or use.

Title: Express your feelings to someone you like
Decscription: Showing love is a way to let your loved ones know that you are committed, loyal, and care about them.
Example: Some ways to express your love include: listening to them and trying to understand them, saying please and thank you, telling them how important they are to you, writing love messages on sticky notes, giving long and tight hugs unexpectedly, taking care of them when they're sick, giving compliments, asking for their advice and appreciating it, and understanding their needs.

Title: Try standing on one leg with your eyes closed for at least 20 seconds, but make sure you're in a safe spot.
Decscription: Research has shown that being able to stand on one leg is a sign of good health and can indicate how well you can balance. Having good balance is connected to our strength and flexibility.
Example: Here are the goals that individuals of different age groups should aim to achieve: Under 40: 45 seconds with eyes open, 15 seconds with eyes closed / Aged 40-49: 42 seconds open, 13 seconds closed / Aged 50-59: 41 seconds open, 8 seconds closed / Aged 60-69: 32 seconds open, 4 seconds closed / Aged 70-79: 22 seconds open, 3 seconds closed

Title: Plant a plant
Decscription: Gardening has a lot of health benefits and can be a fun activity. Having plants in your home or office can bring you joy. Indoor gardening can help reduce stress, increase creativity, productivity, and focus, and aid in recovery.
Example: Plant a tree, Grow Your Own Indoor Edible Garden or plant a plant for indoor, like: Succulent ,Cactus, Pothos, Peperomia , Dieffenbachia , Snake Plant, Rubber Tree

Title: learn 5 new words of new language every day.
Decscription: You can download the Google Translate app for free on your iPhone or Android device. This app allows you to translate both written text and spoken words in more than 100 languages. It can also help you learn how to pronounce words correctly. Create a daily practice schedule, keep a well-organized vocabulary notebook, and review the words again after 24 hours, one week, and one month.

Title: Contact your long lost friends
Decscription: Old friends can remind you of the person you used to be and help get you in touch with parts of yourself that might have become suppressed over the years.

Title: Cut off caffeine at noon every workday for one month
Decscription: Using caffeine for a long time or in doses over 400 mg per day may not be safe. It can lead to problems like difficulty sleeping, feeling nervous or restless, experiencing nausea, having a faster heart rate, and other side effects. If you drink coffee in the evening, it can disrupt your sleep for up to six hours after consuming it.Please note that a cup of brewed coffee (8 ounces) contains around 95 mg of caffeine. Black tea has about 47 mg of caffeine per cup, while green tea has about 28 mg. A can of regular or diet dark cola contains about 34 mg of caffeine. Dark chocolate (100 grams) has around 43 mg of caffeine, while milk chocolate has a quarter of that amount.

Title: Do a puzzle
Decscription: Solving puzzles can strengthen the connections between our brain cells and make our thinking faster. It also helps improve our ability to remember things in the short term.
Example: Sudoku, Crossword, Logic Puzzle, Maze, Mathematical puzzle, Jigsaw, Word Search, Rubik's Cube, Word Search

Title: Learn some magic tricks
Decscription: Creating a magic trick is similar to solving a puzzle. It engages your entire brain and provides a thorough exercise that enhances your creativity and problem-solving abilities.
Example: Rubber pencil trick, Disappearing coin trick, Spoon bending illusion, Magnetic pencil trick, Walk through paper, Levitating card

Title: Watch a good movie
Decscription: Studies suggest that watching movies can increase our emotional intelligence and also help in improving social connectivity.
Example: The Shawshank Redemption (1994) - The Godfather (1972) - The Dark Knight (2008) - The Godfather Part II (1974) - 12 Angry Men (1957) - Schindler's List (1993) - The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (2003) - Pulp Fiction (1994) - The Good, the Bad and the Ugly (1966)

Title: listen to a classical music
Decscription: Listening to classical music is enjoyable and can have a positive effect on our thinking abilities. When we hear something pleasant, it increases dopamine and improves our brain's ability to think and understand. When these two factors work together, it helps keep an aging brain active and healthy.
Example: “The Four Seasons” by Antonio Vivaldi - “Requiem” by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart - “Für Elise” by Ludwig Van Beethoven - “Carmen” by Georges Bizet - “Moonlight Sonata” by Ludwig Van Beethoven - “Toccata and Fugue in D minor” by Johann Sebastian Bach - “Canon In D Major” by Johann Pachelbel - “Nocturne Op. 9 No. 2” by Chopin - Symphony No. 5 Beethoven - “The Symphony No. 9” by Beethoven - “Eine Kleine Nachtmusik” by Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

Title: Dance with a music you like
Decscription: Turn up the music, play your favorite song, and start moving! Including dance in your health and wellness routine can have many benefits. Research shows that people who dance often feel better about themselves and have more confidence. It also gets your heart pumping and improves your balance and core strength. Dancing can make you more flexible, promote healthy bones, and reduce stress. And on top of all that, dancing is a whole lot of fun!

Title: Make an origami
Decscription: When we fold paper to make Origami, it is an activity that stimulates both our mind and body. It helps us focus, concentrate, and improve our ability to coordinate our hands and eyes. It also helps develop our fine motor skills.
Example: Origami Boat, Origami Fly, Origami Candy box, Origami Turtle, Origami Dog Face, Origami Heart, Origami Jumping Frog, Origami Rectangular Box.

Title: Do some cleaning
Decscription: Having a cluttered and messy environment can contribute to feelings of stress and anxiety. However, cleaning up and organizing can have positive effects on our ability to concentrate, be productive, and experience emotional well-being. It can also help clear our minds and improve mental clarity.
Example: Removing dust from surfaces like furniture, shelves, and electronics - Scrubbing the toilet, sink, and bathtub/shower - Washing windows and removing smudges or dirt - Taking out the trash and ensuring proper waste disposal.

Title: Write down your goals
Decscription: Writing down your goals helps you clearly define what you want to achieve and guides your daily actions towards achieving them. Gail Matthews, a psychology professor at Dominican University in California, conducted a study on goal setting with 267 participants. The study revealed that simply writing down your goals increases the likelihood of achieving them by 42 percent. Instead of just briefly stating your goals, take the time to write a paragraph about how it would feel to achieve them. By acting as if you have already achieved your goals, you will begin to see the connections between your current situation and the necessary steps to reach your goals.

Title: Buy a small gift for yourself
Decscription: Self-gifting means treating yourself to something nice as a way to show that you deserve happiness. It also gives you an opportunity to take a break and rejuvenate yourself.
Example: A chocolate - A candle - Some stationary - A cake -  A new house plant - New wallet - A good book - Magazine subscription

Title: Write a very accurate note about one of your dreams
Decscription: Writing down your dreams helps you remember important things. It also helps clear your mind and understand your emotions and thoughts, including how your dreams impact them. Additionally, it can help you come up with creative solutions to problems. Keep a journal for your dreams near your bed so you can easily write in it when you wake up in the morning. Try to include as many details as possible and compare your dreams to your real-life experiences.

Title: Listen to podcasts or radio
Decscription: Podcasts have indeed gained significant popularity in recent years. They offer a convenient and accessible way to expand your knowledge, gain valuable insights, receive free coaching, and discover new ideas.
Example: There are various podcast apps available for mobile devices, such as Google Podcasts, Apple Podcasts, Amazon Music, Spotify, Stitcher, and SoundCloud.

Title: Start a Do It Yourself (DIY) project for your home
Decscription: Engaging in do-it-yourself (DIY) projects can have several positive effects on your well-being. It can help you feel less stressed and improve your mood. DIY projects also provide an opportunity to learn new skills. Additionally, they allow you to spend quality time with your family. Another benefit is that DIY projects can help you save money. Lastly, DIY projects encourage physical activity and can help you stay active.
Example: Indoor Hanging Planter - Rustic Blanket Ladder - Reclaimed Wood Wall Art - Seashell Mirror - Entryway Bench - Chalk Painted Bottles - Rope Basket - Macrame Plant Hangers - A Picture Wall - Old Tyre and Rope Ottomans

Title: Learn to make homemade slime
Decscription: Slime is liked by many people for different reasons. Some enjoy watching slime change from a solid to a liquid and then back again. Others find it relaxing to squish and play with slime, which can help reduce stress. Some people simply like slime because it's gooey and enjoyable to stretch and play with.

Title: Learn how to meditate
Decscription: Meditation can give you a sense of calm, peace and balance that can benefit both your emotional well-being and your overall health. 1. Find a peaceful and quiet place to sit. 2. Wear comfortable clothes. 3. Decide how long you want to meditate for. 4. Sit in a comfortable position. 5. Make sure your back is straight when you sit. 6. If it helps you relax and concentrate, close your eyes. 7. Pay attention to your breathing. 8. Use mental images to help guide your breathing.

Title: Explore a new location in your city or state that you haven't visited before or haven't had the chance to explore extensively
Improve your public speaking skill
Decscription: Learning how to speak confidently in front of others is important for various situations, such as leading meetings, improving leadership abilities, delivering important messages, or becoming a respected voice.
Example: Practice speaking in front of a mirror - Record yourself speaking and review it - Try speaking without pausing - Practice speaking in the shower - Write speeches to enhance your skills.

Title: Improve your photography skill
Decscription: Over time, even the best memories fade. But a photograph can last a lifetime.
Example: Keep the lens clean - Use gridlines to balance your shot - Try using the rule of thirds - Pay attention to lighting - Avoid using flash - Use HDR mode- Focus on one subject - Find different perspectives - Look for symmetry - Avoid zooming in capture small details.

Title: Listen to a genre of music you haven't tried before
Decscription: Listening to different types of music can help you feel more at ease when trying out new sounds. It can also bring out specific emotions that might inspire your creativity.
Example: Classical - Jazz- Punk - Blues - Hip hop -Country

Title: Go to your nearby library and borrow a book, or visit a bookstore and purchase a book.
Visit a local museum or art gallery in next week
Research the culture of a different country online
Decscription: By researching the culture of a different country online, you can learn more about how people from that country live and think. This knowledge can help you have more meaningful interactions with people around you. Additionally, exploring different cultures can expose you to new perspectives, which can inspire innovative ideas.
Example: India, Guatemala, Japan or Sweden

Title: Watch a classic film
Example: Casablanca - The Godfather - The Wizard of Oz - Gone with the Wind - Citizen Kane

Title: Plan a day trip to somewhere outside your city
Decscription: Day trips are the perfect opportunity to take a break, relax and enjoy being together as a family.

Title: Plan a picnic
Decscription: You can have a wonderful time reconnecting with loved ones by having a simple picnic with a few snacks and light dishes. Picnics are enjoyable and calming, allowing you to create lasting memories and cherish the company of others.
Example: Create DIY sandwiches - Put down your phone - Play some outdoor sports - Take memorable pictures - Watch the sunset - fly a kite

Title: Fill out crossword puzzle with your family/friends
Decscription: Puzzles are a fun way to spend time, interact with friends and family, and challenge our own knowledge and memory.

Title: Try to write a short story
Decscription: Writing can help improve your thinking skills and memory, reduce stress, and make you feel better. To get started, come up with an idea for your writing. Then, make an outline or think about your characters. Write an interesting beginning and a strong ending. After you're done, read your story out loud. Edit and make changes as needed. Lastly, ask others for feedback to improve your writing even more.

Title: Sing along to some songs
Decscription: Singing makes people happy and brings joy to their lives. It also boosts confidence and helps people feel more connected to themselves in positive and caring ways, which helps them live a good life.

Title: Make a list of your wishes
Decscription: When creating a wish list, you can write down anything you want, even if it's not realistic. Imagine your perfect situation and set a timer for 5-10 minutes. Write down everything that comes to your mind without holding back. It's helpful to be detailed and specific because the more specific you are, the better!
Example: Travel related wishes – Buying a house - Life milestones - Personal finances - Quality time with loved ones - Buying an instrument

Title: Make a gratitude list
Decscription: Research has shown that expressing gratitude and appreciating the good things in life can improve sleep, reduce stress, and enhance relationships with others. There is also some evidence suggesting that it may lower the chances of heart disease and alleviate symptoms of depression in certain individuals.
Example: Write down at least 5 things every time you make a list -  Include plenty of detail - Focus on experiences and people instead of object

Title: Give yourself a pep talk
Decscription: Pep talks, or positive self-talk, are like conversations we have with ourselves to help us deal with different situations and challenges. We can either think or say these words out loud. The great thing about self-talk is that we trust ourselves more than we trust others, so it can be really helpful in boosting our confidence and motivation.
Example: You've got this! Believe in yourself and your abilities - Remember all the times you've overcome challenges before - You are strong, resilient, and capable - Keep pushing forward and never give up - Trust in your potential and know that you have what it takes to succeed - Stay focused, stay determined, and keep striving for your goals - You are capable of achieving great things - Keep going and make yourself proud!

Title: Try to not use social media for at least a day
Decscription: A research study discovered that many students experienced positive changes in their mood, reduced anxiety, and better sleep when they took a break from social media. For example, you can try turning off notifications, limiting the time you spend on social media, connecting with friends and family in person, treating social media as a special reward, and deleting unused social media apps.

Title: Create some arts
Decscription: Art allows us to show who we are and express ourselves. Making art can calm our minds and help us feel better in the present. It can also help us heal from difficult experiences we've had in the past.
Example: Draw a landscape - Make a collage - Do finger painting - Do some easy acrylic painting - sketch poses - Do paper quilling - Make a nature prints arts - Draw a doodle art

Title: Sort through your handbag / Wallet
Decscription: Being organized and having a clean environment has many advantages. It helps you work better and be more productive. It also improves your performance and gives you a sense of control, which is important for managing stress and staying resilient.
Example: Tip everything out of your bag. Shake out any remaining debris over a bin or, for a deeper clean, use a vacuum on a gentle setting.

Title: Clean your garage/basement or shed
Decscription: By cleaning your garage, you can solve or prevent pest issues from getting worse. Many pests, like bugs and rats, can find a cozy home in your garage. Cleaning out your basement or garage gives you the opportunity to donate any items you don't use to people who could benefit from them. Getting rid of unwanted items also creates more space inside your home.

Title: Clean out your closet
Decscription: Cleaning out your closet regularly is a great way to take stock and organise what you have. It allows you to make the most out of what you have more easily.

Title: Fix something around the house on your own.
Example: Tightening loose screws - Fix Leaking Plumbing Pipes - Fixing a smelly dishwasher - Fix Loud Cabinet Doors - Get Dents Out of Wood - Feed the lawn - Remove hard water build up with a lemon

Title: Clean at least one pair of your shoes
Decscription: To clean fabric shoes, start by brushing off any dirt on the surface. Then, in a small bowl, mix one teaspoon of dishwashing liquid with two cups of warm water. Stir the mixture well. Take an old toothbrush and dip it into the soapy solution. Gently scrub the fabric of the shoes with the toothbrush. After that, use a dry paper towel to blot away any soapy residue. Finally, let the shoes air dry in a place away from direct heat and sunlight.

Title: Give an old piece new life
Decscription: It's an amazing feeling to create something new and useful out of something old and run-down.
Example: paint a whole piece of furniture - paint an old metal chairs - Tin can planters – transform vintage teacups into teacup candles - transform jam jars into Salt & pepper shakers - transform jam jars into little terrarium - transform an old soccer ball into flower pot

Title: Take a nature walk and do photography Hunt.
Decscription: Being outside in green spaces supports an active and healthy lifestyle It may help reduce anxiety and depression. Photography Hunt in a nature walk refers to an activity where participants explore a natural environment, such as a park or forest, with the goal of capturing photographs of specific subjects or themes. It involves searching for interesting and visually appealing scenes, landscapes, plants, animals, or other elements of nature to photograph. The Photography Hunt encourages observation, creativity, and appreciation of the natural world through the lens of a camera.

Title: Go through old family albums.
Decscription: Going through old family albums is beneficial for several reasons. Firstly, it allows you to reconnect with cherished memories and moments from the past. It can evoke feelings of nostalgia and bring back happy emotions. Secondly, it provides an opportunity to learn more about your family history and heritage. Old photographs often hold valuable information about your ancestors and their lives. Additionally, going through family albums can strengthen family bonds and create opportunities for storytelling and sharing experiences with loved ones. It can be a meaningful and enjoyable activity that brings generations together.

Title: Start learning a new skill
Decscription: Learning keeps your mind engaged and body active, It gives you motivation and boosts your confidence.
Example: Master Photography Skill - Learn how to how to edit images and create graphics from scratch using Adobe Photoshop - Learn How to Draw - Learn basic car repairs - learn to play the guitar - Learn basic self-defence - Learn to change a flat tire - Learning to sew, stitch, and patch

Title: Learn some first aids
Decscription: Having some basic knowledge of first aid can help you handle critical situations and potentially save lives.
Example: CPR - Heimlich Maneuver - Set a Splint - Stop the Bleeding - Treat a Burn

Title: Write a Letter to Your Future Self
Decscription: Writing letters to yourself can be a powerful way to improve yourself because they help you realign with your values, remember what is important to you, and recommit to your goals. Before you begin, decide how old you want to be when you read this letter in the future. Start by reminding yourself of who you are currently. Write down your fears, share your current beliefs and values, note your skills and abilities, define your goals and aspirations, and include things you want to stop, continue, and start doing. Give yourself advice and ask yourself some questions. Once you are done, seal the letter and store it in a safe place.

Title: Contact a family member you haven't spoken to lately
Do some stargazing.
Decscription: Gazing at the stars can be a calming and enjoyable way to spend your time. It can also be a great opportunity to learn new things.

Title: Do some stretches during the day
Decscription: Stretching helps to keep our muscles flexible, strong, and in good health. It is important for maintaining a wide range of motion in our joints. Without regular stretching, our muscles can become tight and shortened.
Example: Cobra stretch - Knees to chest - Spinal twist - Upper back stretch - Neck stretch - Shoulder stretch - Side stretch - Standing quad stretch

Title: Learn to start a fire without matches
Decscription: Learning how to start a fire without a lighter or matches is an essential skill to have when you find yourself in a bad situation. However, it is crucial to ensure that you do so in a safe location, preferably outdoors and away from any structures.
Example: The hand drill method - Fire Plough - Bow Drill - Flint and Steel - Lens-Based Methods - Soda Can and Chocolate Bar method

Title: Try to write a poetry
Decscription: Writing poetry can help you become more mindful of the way words and sentences sound. This can enhance your storytelling skills in fiction writing and enable you to effectively convey your emotions and feelings.

Title: Try going vegetarian for a week
Decscription: During this time, avoid eating meat, including fish and poultry. Compared to people who eat meat, vegetarians usually consume less saturated fat and cholesterol, but more vitamins C and E, dietary fiber, folic acid, potassium, magnesium, and plant chemicals called phytochemicals, like carotenoids and flavonoids. A vegetarian diet can give you more energy and make you feel healthier.

Title: Learn to breathe properly for better health.
Decscription: Proper breathing is vital for all bodily systems. It not only enhances mental clarity but also improves sleep, digestion, immune response, and reduces stress. To practice diaphragm breathing in a chair, sit comfortably with bent knees. Relax your shoulders, head, and neck. Place one hand on your upper chest and the other below your rib cage to feel the movement of your diaphragm. Inhale slowly through your nose, allowing your stomach to press against your hand. Keep the hand on your chest still. Exhale through pursed lips, engaging your abdominal muscles, while keeping the hand on your upper chest still. Repeat this breathing technique throughout your exercise session.Continue breathing like this for the duration of your exercise session.

Title: Read a magazine or newspaper
Decscription: Magazines and newspapers provide information about what's popular and help you become knowledgeable in your area of interest. They can also improve your language skills and enhance your writing abilities. By reading them, you can stay updated on the latest global developments.

Title: Go birdwatching
Decscription: Birdwatching is a great way to get into nature and learn more about the incredible native wildlife.

Title: Do some crafts at home
Decscription: Studies have found that engaging in crafts, no matter what materials you use, can boost your mood, increase your self-confidence, and help you feel less stressed.
Example: Easy Painted Rocks - Photo Collage - String art with yarn - Toilet paper roll desk organizer - Yarn wall hanging - Cork Stamps - Crepe paper flowers

Title: Practice positive daydreaming
Decscription: Daydreaming can actually improve your creativity and problem-solving abilities. It can also help you concentrate and stay focused on a particular task. However, it's important not to daydream excessively. To make the most of daydreaming, try these tips: pick the right time, find a suitable place, engage in mindless activities, imagine the future you desire, have a clear goal for your daydream, and let your thoughts wander in a positive direction.

Title: Give a small gift to one of your loved ones
Decscription: Giving gifts gives people a chance to share their emotions, show gratitude towards others, or simply spread kindness in the community. It's a wonderful and gentle way to demonstrate that you care about someone.
Example: Personalized keychain -  A handwritten note or letter expressing your love and appreciation - A small potted plant or succulent - A scented candle - A cozy and soft blanket or throw - A small piece of jewelry - A book by their favorite author - A gourmet chocolate or a box of their favorite treats

Title: Visit a flower market
Decscription: Scientific studies have proven that flowers can really make you feel happier and less stressed. They have the power to uplift your mood and reduce feelings of anxiety.

Title: Complete an old unfinished task
Decscription: An unfinished task can cause stress and anxiety through intrusive thoughts
Example: Completing a half-finished art or craft project - Repairing or restoring a piece of furniture - Decluttering and organizing digital files on a computer or smartphone - Cleaning and tidying up a neglected garden or outdoor space - Finishing a book that was started but never completed

Title: Re-engage in an old favourite hobby
Decscription: Re-engaging in an old favorite hobby can be a fulfilling and enjoyable experience. It allows you to reconnect with something that brings you joy and can provide a sense of nostalgia. Whether it's playing a musical instrument, painting, gardening, or any other hobby.

Title: Plan having lunch/dinner with a friend
Decscription: Eating with friends and family can lead to you feeling happier and more satisfied with your life!

Title: Remember happy moments in your childhood
Decscription: Positive memories from childhood, like when your family was happy together, when you had people who supported you, and when you had fun experiences, can make you feel happy, confident, and safe

Title: Light a candle
Decscription: Lighting candles can create a nice feeling in the room that helps you feel calm and good. Candles can also help reduce stress and make you feel better emotionally.

Title: Create a water purifying system at home
Decscription: To create a water purifier: Cut a water bottle in half. Remove the cap from the bottle. Turn the top half of the bottle upside down and place it into the bottom half of the bottle. Place cotton balls, cloth, or a coffee filter inside the bottle as the first layer. The first layer should be about one to two inches thick. Add an inch of activated charcoal as the second layer on top of the cotton layer. Over the charcoal, add about two inches of gravel or small stones as the third layer. Remember, this method is not for making drinkable water, but it can help filter out some impurities.

Title: Discover the capital cities of three countries that you were not previously aware of
Decscription: A capital city is usually where a country does a lot of its important business, culture, and where most people live. Capital cities are often places with a long history of trade, communication, and transportation.
Example: It can be capital city of: Bolivia - Indonesia - Libya - Kazakhstan - Portugal - Hungry

Title: Secure Your Mobile Phon
Decscription: Phone security, or keeping your phone safe, is about protecting your mobile device from different kinds of cyber-attacks that can harm your privacy, login information, money, and overall safety.
Example: Avoid giving out personal information - Use a strong password or pattern to lock your phone - Do not save passwords - Download apps only from trusted stores - Back up your data - Keep your operating system and apps updated - Log out of sites after you make a payment - Avoid public Wi-Fi and only use secure Wi-Fi - Set up remote wipe capabilities

Title: Learn about 3 World Leader that you may not know about
Decscription: Studying world leaders allows us to gain a broader perspective on global affairs, expand our cultural knowledge, develop critical thinking skills, and find inspiration for personal growth.
Example: Ramses II, Egyptian Pharaoh - Pericles, Greek Politician - Wu Zetian Empress of China - Cyrus the Great King of Persia - Tecumseh Shawnee Chief - Mahatma Gandhi, Indian Civil Rights Activist

Title: Learn about indigenous cultures around the world
Decscription: There are 476 million Indigenous people all over the world, living in more than 90 countries. They have a long history and traditions that are important to their culture. We can learn a lot from their knowledge and the way they do things.
Example: Janajatis in Nepal - Inuit in Arctic - Maori in New Zealand - Maya Mesoamerica Yanomami in Amazon rainforest

Title: Learn 5 Facts about animals that you may not know about
Example: You can learn about snail - Blue Whales - crocodiles - seahorse - spiders - Giraffes

Title: learn 3 interesting facts about the milky way
Decscription: Learning about the Milky Way expands our knowledge of the universe, contributes to scientific progress, and has practical implications for technology and innovation.
Example: Size and Structure - Galactic Center - Stellar Population - Spiral Arms - Dark Matter

Title: Learn how to compost
Decscription: Composting is a way to recycle things like leaves and food scraps into a special kind of plant food. It's good for the environment because it reduces the amount of waste that goes to landfills and helps prevent pollution. You can start composting by collecting things like fruit and vegetable peels, coffee grounds, and eggshells. Put them in a pile or a container and let them break down over time. After about a year, you'll have compost that you can use to make your plants grow better.

Title: Take Care of your Skin, Hair and Nail
Decscription: To care for your skin, hair, and nails, remember these daily habits: apply sunscreen, drink plenty of water, avoid sugary drinks, prioritize sleep, and steer clear of tobacco products. For a healthy diet, focus on consuming eggs, nuts, beans, whole grains, avocados, berries, carrots, spinach, pumpkin, milk, citrus fruits, kiwi, cashews, mushrooms, and seafood. These choices can benefit your overall well-being.

Title: Take care of the environment
Decscription: The environment is not just where we live, but everything that keeps us alive. It includes things like the food we eat, the water we drink, the air we breathe, and our homes. Taking care of the environment is important because it helps us stay healthy and alive. It's something that should come naturally to us.
Example: Don't throw litter on the ground - Cut down on what you throw away - Buy less plastic and bring a reusable shopping bag - Plant More Trees - Choose non-toxic chemicals in the home and office - Save Electricity - Save Water - Save Fuel - Go Paperless or Use Less Paper - Quit Smoking

Title: Laugh for a minimum of 15 minutes a day
Decscription: Laughing is really good for you! It helps make your immune system stronger, makes you feel happier, reduces pain, and protects you from the harmful effects of stress. So, remember to laugh often because it's great for your overall well-being!
Example: Use other people's laughter to trigger your own - Share funny videos - Watch funny shows, movies and clips - Spend time with children

Title: Learn about 3 famous buildings around the world that you may not know about
Example: Sagrada Familia, Empire State Building, Lotus Temple, Neuschwanstein Castle

Title: Learn about 3 famous artists you may not have known about
Example: Michelangelo - Rembrandt - Vermeer - Claude Monet - Edvard Munch

Title: Learn about 3 famous rivers of the world
Example: The Ganges river - The Mississippi River - The Yangtze River - The Volga River

Title: Learn about 3 most famous paintings in the world
Example: The Kiss - The Birth of Venus - Guernica - Whistler's Mother - Café Terrace at Night - The Two Fridas

Title: Learn and play chess.
Decscription: Playing chess can make your brain stronger. It can help you remember things better, plan ahead, and solve problems. It might also make some brain conditions feel better.

Title: Learn to control your temper.
Decscription: Sometimes, when we get really angry, it can cause problems if we start being aggressive, having big outbursts, or even getting into fights. It's important to learn how to control our anger so that we don't say or do things that we might feel sorry about later.
Example: Count to 100 - Drink some water - Stop talking - Give yourself a break. Sit away from others - Write down what you're feeling and how you want to respond - Talk to someone you trust

Title: Learn how to deal with personal criticism in a positive and productive way.
Decscription: When someone gives you feedback or criticism, it's important to listen carefully to understand what they mean. Take your time to think about it before responding. You don't need to say sorry for receiving criticism. Instead, thank those who give you helpful feedback. Remember that words can't harm you, so don't let them upset you. It's important to know that criticism doesn't define your value as a person. Stay confident and keep in mind that constructive criticism can help you improve and become a better version of yourself.

Title: Learn how to lift heavy stuff safely.
Decscription: Lifting heavy things by yourself might seem cool, but it can hurt you if you don't do it safely. To avoid getting hurt, try lifting one corner of the object to see how heavy it is. When you lift, bend your knees and keep your back straight. Use your legs to lift the object, not your back. Walk slowly when carrying the object. And when you put it down, bend your knees again.

Title: Write down your daily goals and to-do list.
Decscription: Every day, make a list of the things you want to get done. Write down 1-3 goals for the day and focus on completing them. Make sure your goals are specific and doable, so you can easily imagine yourself doing them.

Title: Take 10 minutes every day to sit quietly and imagine your dreams.
Decscription: Taking 10 minutes daily to sit quietly and visualize our dreams helps us clarify our goals, increase motivation, and create a positive mindset. It allows us to focus on what we truly want, inspiring us to take action towards achieving our dreams. This practice also helps reduce stress and promotes a sense of calm and clarity in our daily lives.

Title: Do an easy pencil drawing.
Example: A simple flower with overlapping petals -  A cute cartoon character with basic shapes like circles and squares - A landscape with a few trees and a winding path - A still life of a fruit bowl with a few apples and oranges.

Title: Start a new hobby.
Decscription: Having hobbies can make life more enjoyable and give you a sense of freedom. They can help reduce stress, make you happier, and boost your confidence.
Example: Hiking - Fishing - painting - Yoga - Scrapbooking - Knitting - Dance - Cooking - Origami - Pottery - Woodworking - Stamp or coin collecting

Title: Leave a funny and kind message for one of your friends to make them laugh.
Think about your retirement
Decscription: Begin considering small changes in your lifestyle and money choices. Moss says that the happiest retired people are skilled at traveling, playing, and exploring. They enthusiastically participate in three or more hobbies regularly.

Title: Start a buddy read.
Decscription: A buddy read is when you and someone else decide to read the same book at the same time so you can talk about it together. Lots of people in the book community really like doing buddy reads.

Title: Stop complaining for at least 3 days.
Decscription: Challenging yourself to stop complaining can have several benefits. Firstly, it helps cultivate a positive mindset by shifting your focus towards gratitude and solutions rather than dwelling on problems. Secondly, it improves your communication skills as you learn to express yourself in a constructive and solution-oriented manner. Lastly, it enhances your overall well-being by reducing stress and promoting a more optimistic outlook on life.

Title: Learn to how to dress properly.
Decscription: The way you look is usually the first thing people notice about you. To make a good impression, avoid wearing too many different colors in one outfit. Wear clothes that fit you well and make you look good. Try not to wear clothes with logos or flashy words on them. Choose outerwear that can be worn with different outfits. You can also read fashion websites and use apps like Pinterest website or app for style inspiration.

Title: Watch a spectator sport.
Decscription: Watch a spectator sport like football, handball, volleyball, basketball, ice hockey, or tennis to experience the excitement of competitive games and witness the skillful performances of athletes. It's a great way to immerse yourself in the energy of the game, cheer for your favorite team or player, and appreciate the strategic moves and athletic abilities on display. Whether you enjoy the physicality of football or the finesse of tennis, there's a spectator sport for everyone to enjoy.

Title: Challenge yourself to NOT lie for a week.
Decscription: Challenging ourselves to not lie for a week is beneficial for several reasons. Firstly, it promotes honesty and integrity, which are important values in building trust and maintaining healthy relationships. Secondly, it encourages self-reflection and awareness of our own communication habits. Lastly, it can lead to personal growth and improved self-esteem as we become more authentic and genuine in our interactions with others.

Title: Volunteer as a family.
Decscription: Volunteering is one of the most important things you can do as a family. If you want to raise kids who make the world a better place, help them find ways to serve others. It's also one of the best ways to spend quality time together.
Example: Make and donate food to disadvantaged people. Clean up your community, Gardening and Maintenance

Title: Go to a fair, carnival, circus, zoo or amusement park.
Decscription: Going to a fair, carnival, circus, zoo, or amusement park can be a fun and enjoyable experience for several reasons. Firstly, it offers a break from routine and allows you to engage in recreational activities, which can help reduce stress and bring joy. Secondly, these places often provide opportunities for socializing and spending quality time with friends or family. Lastly, they offer a wide range of attractions, such as thrilling rides, entertaining shows, and unique exhibits, which can create lasting memories and provide a sense of excitement and wonder.

Title: Listen to the sounds of nature.
Decscription: Listening to the sounds of nature allows us to connect with the environment, find peace, and reduce stress. It helps us appreciate the beauty of the natural world and promotes mindfulness. By actively listening, we can also learn about different species and gain a deeper understanding of our surroundings.

Title: Go to a beach, River or lake.
Decscription: Visiting the beach, lake, or river offers a refreshing escape from daily routines, allowing us to relax and unwind. The soothing sounds of water and the beauty of nature promote a sense of calm and rejuvenation. It also provides opportunities for outdoor activities, such as swimming or picnicking, fostering physical and mental well-being.

Title: Host a family game night.
Decscription: Game nights can be beneficial for our health in several ways. Firstly, they provide an opportunity for social interaction and bonding with friends or family, which can improve our mental and emotional well-being. Engaging in games also stimulates our cognitive abilities, such as problem-solving, critical thinking, and memory recall. Additionally, participating in games often involves physical activity or movement, which can contribute to improved physical health and coordination. Overall, game nights offer a fun and engaging way to promote overall well-being.
Example: Monopoly - Uno - Jenga - 20 questions - card games - musical chairs - egg and spoon race

Title: Visit the cemetery to remember your departed loved one.
Decscription: Visiting the cemetery can help you think seriously about the future and is a nice place to remember and spend time with family, keeping the memory of your loved one alive. It can also make you feel closer to the person you care about.

Title: Learn the art of saying “NO” to others.
Decscription: Saying no gives us more control over our lives, allowing us to create a satisfying and meaningful life based on our own choices. Here are some tips to help you say no: Give yourself permission to say no, try using 'LATER' instead of 'NO' practice saying no, don't feel obligated to explain yourself, suggest an alternative if possible, and show gratitude to the person while wishing them well.

Title: List some positive qualities about yourself.
Decscription: Recognizing and acknowledging our positive qualities can boost self-esteem, improve self-confidence, and promote a positive self-image. It can also help us appreciate our strengths and abilities, leading to a more positive outlook on life.
Example: Organised - Strong - Ambitious - Respectful - Adventurous - Creative - Friendly - Appreciative - Diligent - Kind - Funny - Good cook - Responsible - A good friend

Title: Improve your self confidence.
Decscription: Feeling confident prepares us for life's challenges. When we're confident, we're more likely to embrace new experiences and opportunities instead of avoiding them. Even if things don't go well initially, confidence motivates us to give it another try.
Example: Recognise what you're good at - Surround yourself with positive people - Stop comparing yourself to others - Practice positive self-talk - Face your fears - Be kind to yourself - Learn to be assertive - Start saying NO - Take care of your body

Title: Try to become a better listener.
Decscription: Being a good listener is important in every part of life. It helps us solve problems, settle arguments, and make our relationships better. Here are some tips: Be fully there when someone is talking to you. Don't interrupt them. Listen without judging or deciding things too quickly. Show that you're listening. Don't start thinking about what you want to say next. Don't force your ideas or answers on others. Stay focused and ask questions that make sense.

Title: Wake up 15 minutes earlier to make a real breakfast.
Decscription: Eating breakfast has been proven by many studies to be good for your health. It gives you more energy and helps you focus right away. In the long run, it can also help you manage your weight, lower the chances of getting type 2 diabetes and heart disease.

Title: Try to remember people's names.
Decscription: Names are important in building new relationships because they are tied to a person's identity. Using and remembering someone's name shows that you value and understand them better. Here are some tips: Don't say you're bad at remembering names, repeat the name when you meet someone new, associate the name with something familiar, and say the name again when you say goodbye.

Title: Try to Meet new people.
Decscription: Making friends can be difficult as adults because we often have established routines and habits. However, having close friends and social connections can help protect us from problems like ongoing stress and high blood pressure.
Example: Take classes - Volunteer for a cause you believe in - Look into support groups - Organize something yourself

Title: Donate your blood if you can.
Decscription: A lot of people need blood transfusions to help with their medical problems. Blood donations are also used in emergencies and to treat cancer. Just one donation of blood can save up to 3 lives.

Title: Start developing one good habit.
Decscription: Developing good habits can positively impact your life by helping you achieve your goals, fostering personal and professional growth, and bringing a sense of fulfilment. By incorporating positive behaviors into your daily routine, you can create a pathway to success and a more satisfying life.
Example: Read thoughtful books - Be physically active every day - Get enough sleep and eat breakfast - Drink water instead of soda or juice - Eat plenty of vegetables and some fruit every day - Eat less fast food - Save money

Title: Manage your money wisely.
Decscription: Prioritize essential needs and avoid unnecessary expenses. Allocate 60% of your monthly income to necessary expenses like housing, groceries, utilities, insurance, and transportation. Save and invest 20% of your income. Dedicate 10% to leisure activities and entertainment. Allocate 5% towards learning and education and 5% towards donations and charities.

Title: Take a cold shower.
Decscription: Taking cold showers, where you lower the water temperature below 60 degrees for two to three minutes at a time, can have several benefits. It can help strengthen your immune system, improve blood flow, increase metabolism, reduce inflammation, prevent muscle soreness, and provide relief from localized pain.

Title: Do some sport
Decscription: Being physically active can improve your brain health, help manage weight, reduce the risk of disease, strengthen bones and muscles.
Example: Football - Cricket and Table tennis - Badminton - Swimming - Cycling - Push-ups and Squats - Yoga or Pilates - Dancing or Aerobics

Title: Try something you've always wanted to Try.
Decscription: Take that new class - Ask a friend to teach you to do something you don’t know how to do - Think of something you'd enjoy creating: a blanket, a song, or a small piece of furniture

Title: Improve your lip reading skill.
Decscription: Watch TV and pay attention to how people's lips move when they talk. Look at yourself in the mirror and practice saying the alphabet. Watch a familiar movie without sound to practice understanding the story through visual cues.

Title: Create items for yourself or your loved ones, such as clothes, shoes, hats, bags, jewelry, or anything else that can be used.
Example: Sew your own dresses, shirts, skirts, or pants using patterns and fabric - Customize and decorate plain shoes using paint, fabric or create an simple slippers - Crochet or knit your own hats using yarn and a pattern, or decorate a plain hat with ribbons, flowers, or other accessories - Sew your own tote bags, backpacks, or purses using fabric and a sewing machine, or repurpose old materials like jeans or t-shirts to create unique bags - You can make earrings, necklaces, bracelets, or rings using beads, wire, or other material

Title: Try to say the alphabet backwards.
Decscription: Reciting the alphabet backwards requires mental effort and concentration. It can serve as a mental exercise to improve memory, focus, and cognitive skills.

Title: Learn a few funny jokes.
Decscription: Humor has various positive effects on our well-being, such as reducing stress, improving mood, and fostering social connections. Sharing jokes can help create a lighthearted atmosphere and strengthen relationships with others. However, it's important to be mindful of the context and audience when telling jokes to ensure they are appropriate and well-received.

Title: Memorise your favourite song lyric.
Decscription: Memorizing lyrics can improve your language skills, vocabulary, and memory retention. Additionally, it can be a fun and engaging activity that you can share with others during karaoke sessions or sing-alongs. However, it's important to note that the decision to memorize song lyrics is a personal preference, and not everyone may find it necessary or enjoyable.

Title: Try to eat with your opposition hand.
Decscription: Trying to eat with your non-dominant hand can help improve coordination and dexterity in your non-dominant hand, which can be useful in various activities. Additionally, it can challenge your brain by engaging different neural pathways and promoting mental flexibility. However, it may initially feel awkward or challenging, so it's important to start slowly and be patient with yourself

Title: Track every penny you spend for 30 days.
Decscription: Tracking every penny you spend allows you to gain a clear understanding of your spending habits and helps you identify areas where you may be overspending or where you can make adjustments to save money. By tracking your expenses, you can develop a budget, set financial goals, and make informed decisions about your spending. It promotes financial awareness and can lead to better money management in the long run.

Title: Say “thank you” instead of “I'm sorry.
Decscription: When we switch from apologizing to expressing gratitude, we can make the other person feel happier and closer to us. This can also make us feel more confident about ourselves.

Title: Try to sit up straight
Decscription: When you sit or stand with good posture, it helps reduce stress on your muscles and bones. Sitting or standing straight instead of slouching prevents strain on your hips, shoulders, neck, back, and torso. This means less pressure on your bones, joints, and ligaments.

Title: Create a list of things that you love about yourself.
Decscription: Creating a list of things that we love about ourselves can helps to boost our self-esteem and self-confidence by focusing on our positive qualities and strengths. It reminds us of our worth and value as individuals. Additionally, it can serve as a helpful reminder during times of self-doubt or negativity. Reflecting on the things we love about ourselves can also promote self-acceptance and a healthier self-image.

Title: Walk 5,000/8,000/10,000 steps a day.
Decscription: Walking improves cardiovascular fitness, strengthens muscles, and helps maintain a healthy weight. It lowers the risk of chronic conditions like heart disease, diabetes, and certain cancers. Walking releases mood-boosting endorphins, reducing stress, anxiety, and symptoms of depression. It increases energy levels, combats fatigue, and is gentle on the joints. Walking strengthens bones, improves balance, and reduces the risk of osteoporosis and arthritis. It burns calories, aids in weight loss or maintenance, and supports a healthy lifestyle. Remember, 5,000 steps is a general guideline, and individual needs may vary. It's always a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice on physical activity.

Title: Purge your phone.
Decscription: Backup your mobile first! - Delete useless apps - Manage photos and music - Clean up contact list - Delete old text and messages.

Title: Drink more water.
Decscription: The recommended amount of liquid intake can indeed vary based on factors like age, activity level, and overall health. As a general guideline, men are advised to consume around 10 cups of fluids per day, while women are recommended to have approximately 8 cups. It's important to note that various beverages, including water, lower-fat milk, and sugar-free drinks like tea and coffee, contribute to your daily fluid intake.

Title: Learn to forgive others.
Decscription: Forgiving can make you feel better, improve your relationships, and reduce stress. It can also help you let go of harmful anger, which can cause stress, tense muscles, weakened immune system, and heart problems. Remember, forgiveness is your choice and doesn't mean forgetting or approving of what others did. It's about finding inner peace and moving forward.
Example: One quick technique to forgive others is to practice empathy. Try to put yourself in the other person's shoes and understand their perspective. Remind yourself that everyone makes mistakes and has their own struggles. Focus on the positive aspects of the situation or the person, and try to let go of any resentment or anger. It may also be helpful to communicate your feelings calmly and openly with the person involved, if appropriate. Remember, forgiveness is a process that takes time, so be patient with yourself.

Title: Drink more green tea and herbal teas.
Decscription: Green tea has lots of good things called antioxidants and anti-inflammatory stuff that can help fight cancer, cholesterol, and obesity. It can also make your brain work better and lower your chances of getting brain problems. Herbal tea can stop the flu and heart problems, and it can also help prevent issues from diabetes.

Title: Create a list of of tangible things that bring you joy, and make sure to do at least one thing from that list every day.
Example: Reading a favorite book - Looking at cherished photos of loved ones - Listening to uplifting or favorite songs - Being in nature, whether it's a walk in the park or spending time in a garden, can bring a sense of peace and happiness - Viewing or creating art, such as paintings, sculptures, or crafts - Enjoying delicious meals or treats - Engaging in activities like gardening, playing a musical instrument, or crafting - Exploring new places and experiencing different cultures

Title: Improve your nighttime sleep.
Decscription: Getting a good night's sleep helps us feel happier, more awake, and full of energy. To improve your sleep, avoid drinking caffeine 4 to 6 hours before going to bed, avoid alcohol 3 hours before bedtime, and turn off electronic screens 1 hour before bedtime. Invest in a supportive mattress, pillows, and bedding that suit your preferences. Make sure your bedroom is cool, dark, and quiet. Engage in calming activities before bed, such as reading a book, taking a warm bath, or practicing relaxation techniques like deep breathing or meditation. Try to go to bed and wake up at the same time every day, even on weekends. This helps regulate your body's internal clock and promotes better sleep.
